member.name: CRYPT_SIGN_MESSAGE_PARA
member.summary: The CRYPT_SIGN_MESSAGE_PARA structure contains information for signing messages using a specified signing certificate context.

member.name: CRYPT_SIGN_MESSAGE_PARA.cbSize
member.summary: Size of this structure in bytes.

A pointer to the to be used in the signing.
Either the CERT_KEY_PROV_INFO_PROP_ID, or CERT_KEY_CONTEXT_PROP_ID property must be set for the context to provide access to the private signature key.

member.name: CRYPT_SIGN_MESSAGE_PARA.HashAlgorithm
member.summary: CRYPT_ALGORITHM_IDENTIFIER containing the hashing algorithm used to hash the data to be signed.

member.name: CRYPT_SIGN_MESSAGE_PARA.pvHashAuxInfo
member.summary: Not currently used, and must be set to NULL.

member.name: CRYPT_SIGN_MESSAGE_PARA.cMsgCert
member.summary: Number of elements in the rgpMsgCert array of structures. If set to zero no certificates are included in the signed message.

member.name: CRYPT_SIGN_MESSAGE_PARA.rgpMsgCert
member.summary: Array of pointers to structures to be included in the signed message. If the pSigningCert is to be included, a pointer to it must be in the rgpMsgCert array.

member.name: CRYPT_SIGN_MESSAGE_PARA.cMsgCrl
member.summary: Number of elements in the rgpMsgCrl array of pointers to structures. If set to zero, no CRL_CONTEXT structures are included in the signed message.

member.name: CRYPT_SIGN_MESSAGE_PARA.rgpMsgCrl
member.summary: Array of pointers to structures to be included in the signed message.

member.name: CRYPT_SIGN_MESSAGE_PARA.cAuthAttr
member.summary: Number of elements in the rgAuthAttr array. If no authenticated attributes are present in rgAuthAttr, this member is set to zero.

member.name: CRYPT_SIGN_MESSAGE_PARA.rgAuthAttr
member.summary: Array of pointers to structures, each holding authenticated attribute information. If there are authenticated attributes present, the PKCS #9 standard dictates that there must be at least two attributes present, the content type object identifier (OID), and the hash of the message itself. These attributes are automatically added by the system.

member.name: CRYPT_SIGN_MESSAGE_PARA.cUnauthAttr
member.summary: Number of elements in the rgUnauthAttr array. If no unauthenticated attributes are present in rgUnauthAttr, this member is zero.

member.name: CRYPT_SIGN_MESSAGE_PARA.rgUnauthAttr
member.summary: Array of pointers to structures each holding an unauthenticated attribute information. Unauthenticated attributes can be used to contain countersignatures, among other uses.

summary.para: Normally zero. If the encoded output is to be a CMSG_SIGNED inner content of an outer cryptographic message such as a CMSG_ENVELOPED message, the CRYPT_MESSAGE_BARE_CONTENT_OUT_FLAG must be set. If it is not set, the message will be encoded as an inner content type of CMSG_DATA.

CRYPT_MESSAGE_ENCAPSULATED_CONTENT_OUT_FLAG can be set to encapsulate non-data inner content into an OCTET STRING. CRYPT_MESSAGE_KEYID_SIGNER_FLAG can be set to identify signers by their Key Identifier and not their Issuer and Serial Number.
CRYPT_MESSAGE_SILENT_KEYSET_FLAG can be set to suppress any UI by the CSP. For more information about the CRYPT_SILENT flag, see.

member.name: CRYPT_SIGN_MESSAGE_PARA.dwInnerContentType
member.summary: Normally zero. Set to the encoding type of the input message if that input to be signed is the encoded output of another cryptographic message.

member.name: CRYPT_SIGN_MESSAGE_PARA.HashEncryptionAlgorithm
member.summary: A. If present and not NULL, it is used instead of the signer's certificate PublicKeyInfo.Algorithm member. Note that for RSA, the hash encryption algorithm is normally the same as the public key algorithm. For DSA, the hash encryption algorithm is normally a DSS signature algorithm. This member can only be used if CRYPT_SIGN_MESSAGE_PARA_HAS_CMS_FIELDS is defined.

member.name: CRYPT_SIGN_MESSAGE_PARA.pvHashEncryptionAuxInfo
member.summary: Currently not used and must be set to NULL. This member can only be used if CRYPT_SIGN_MESSAGE_PARA_HAS_CMS_FIELDS is defined.
